intro: Biota triangularis, commonly known as the triangular balsam, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It features striking triangular-shaped leaves that are often a deep green with a velvety texture. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
